title: LC circuit - frequency dependence on charge

content.question: A circuit consists of a charged capacitor, an inductor, and an open switch. The switch is closed, and the angular frequency of the oscillation of the charge stored on the capacitor is <math alttext="omega sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>ω</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>. The switch is opened, and the capacitor is replaced with one with the same capacitance, but a greater initial charge. The switch is again closed, and the angular frequency of the oscillation of the charge stored on the capacitor is <math alttext="omega sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>ω</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>. How does <math alttext="omega sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>ω</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> compare to <math alttext="omega sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>ω</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="omega sub 2 is less than omega sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>ω</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>ω</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>
<math alttext="omega sub 2 equals omega sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>ω</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>ω</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>
<math alttext="omega sub 2 is greater than omega sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>ω</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>ω</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>
The angular frequency will depend on the time at which it is measured.

content.answer: <math alttext="omega sub 2 equals omega sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>ω</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>ω</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>

topic.text: 13.6: Circuits with Capacitors and Inductors (LC Circuits)

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
